text: {| |} RFA Wave Prince (A207) was a Wave-class fleet support tanker of the Royal Fleet Auxiliary. She was built by Sir J. Laing & Sons Ltd at Sunderland and was employed as an underway replenishment oiler. During 1961-1962 she was modified extensively, laid up at Devonport in August 1965 and arrived in Burriana, Spain for scrapping on 16 December 1971.http://www.historicalrfa.org/rfa-wave-prince-ships-details ==References== Category:Wave-class oilers Category:Tankers of the Royal Fleet Auxiliary Category:Ministry of War Transport ships Category:World War II merchant ships of the United Kingdom Category:1945 ships Category:Ships built on the River Wear
title: RFA Wave Prince (A207)
